intro: Polygala paucifolia var. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, cylindrical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of xerophytic vegetation.
